data.name: aligmentWidthToolTip
data.value: Width of alignment lines. Usually few milimeters. (default 0)

data.name: alignLinesWarningMessage
data.value: Some positions for alignment lines are checked, but frame width is zero. Do you wish to continue?

data.name: alignLinesWarningMessage2
data.value: No positions for alignment lines are checked, but frame width is greater than zero. Do you wish to continue?

data.name: centerAlignmentToolTip
data.value: Alignment lines are in the middle of lenticules. When positioning final image on lenticule material, alignment line´s color is seen from the front. Ideal for 3-D. (default)

data.name: clearAllTooltip
data.value: (Ctrl + E) Removes all pictures from list.

data.name: copyPicTooltip
data.value: (Ctrl + D) Chosen pictures are duplicated X times, depends on the number in "Number of copies"

data.name: dpiToolTip
data.value: Basic resolution of printing machine. Typical values are 600 DPI for HP and Canon printers, 720 DPI for Epson printers. (default 0)

data.name: edgeAlignmentToolTip
data.value: Alignment lines are on the edge between lenticules. When positioning final image on lenticule material, alignment line´s color is seen from the side.

data.name: fileNotFoundError
data.value: File {0} could not be opened. File probably does not exist.

data.name: horizontalLenticuleOrientation
data.value: Lenticules are positioned horizontally, that means image is changing while view is changing from down to top. CANNOT BE USED for 3D.

data.name: imageDimensionError
data.value: Image dimensions differ. Do you want to crop them to minimum width and minimum height?

data.name: imageSaveError2
data.value: File {0} could not be saved. Check writing privileges and make sure there is enough space.

data.name: keepAspectRatioToolTip
data.value: When field is checked, both height and width is being changed while keeping their aspect ratio. (default ON)

data.name: libraryLoadError
data.value: Error loading graphics library. Make sure Visual C++ Redistributable is installed.

data.name: lineBackgroundColorToolTip
data.value: Color of space between alignment lines. Typically white. (default white)

data.name: lineColorToolTip
data.value: Color of alignment lines. Typically black. (default black)

data.name: linesIndentToolTip
data.value: Odsazení pruhů od obrázku. Usually from zero to five milimeters. Value greater than zero is suitable when clipping final lenticule image. (default 0)

data.name: lineWidthGroupBox
data.value: Thickness of alignment lines. Small values are suitable for precise positioning of lenticule material, but put higher demands on print. (default 25 %)

data.name: lpiToolTip
data.value: Visual span of lenticules obtained by so called pitchtest. Typical values are between 20 and 100.

data.name: maxImagesUnderLenticuleToolTip
data.value: Maximum amout of images, that can be put into lenticule image. Ideally, there is exactly that amout of images, whereas some images can be repeated. If maximum amout is 18, it´s appropriate to put 18 different views on the scene when doing 3D images. When doing flip of two images, it´s appropriate to use first image 9 times and second image 9 times as well. If maximum amout of images is very distant from whole number (etc. 14.6), chosen printer isn´t appropriate for chosen lenticule material.

data.name: moveDownTooltip
data.value: (Ctrl + down arrow) Moves chosen pictures down in list.

data.name: moveUpTooltip
data.value: (Ctrl + up arrow) Moves chosen pictures up in list.

data.name: outputImageHeightToolTip
data.value: Height of output image. Final image may contain alignment lines and be higher. (default 0)

data.name: outputImageWidthToolTip
data.value: Width of output image. Final image may contain alignment lines and be wider. (default 0)

data.name: printParamAdjustmentToolTip
data.value: Cubic (3D, animation, flip) (default) Lanczos (3D, animation, flip) Linear (3D, animation, flip) Nearest neighbour (flip)

data.name: removePicTooltip
data.value: (Del) Removes chosen pictures from lenticule image.

data.name: replaceTooltip
data.value: (Ctrl + Q) Replaces chosen picture with another picture from hard disk.

data.name: revertTooltip
data.value: (Ctrl + R) Reverses list of pictures. Usefull especially for 3-D, because pictures must be in order from most left picture to most right picture.

data.name: sortTooltip
data.value: Sort images by their ending number (Ctrl + S) Sorts list of pictures. Usefull especially for 3-D and animation, if pictures names contain order. Don´t forget to chech when wokring with 3-D if pictures are in order from most left to most right picture. If not, use button "Reverse".

data.name: verticalLenticuleOrientation
data.value: Lenticules are positioned vertically, that means image is changing while view is changing from left to right. (default)
